p: J774A.1 macrophages (ATCC, from LGC Standards, Milan, Italy) were used for in vitro experiments. Macrophages were routinely maintained at 37 °C in a humidified atmosphere of 5% CO 2 and were cultured in Dulbecco’s Modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM, Lonza Group, Milan, Italy) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS, Sigma Aldrich, Milan, Italy) 100 U/mL penicillin and 100 μg/L streptomycin, 2 mM l-glutamine, 20 mM Hepes [4-(2-hydroxyethyl)-1-piperazineethanesulphonic acid] and 1 mM Na pyruvate. The medium was changed every 48 h in conformity with the manufacturer’s protocols.
